oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Young Memphis Women Receive Recognition for Stellar Work With Nurses Aides"
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: medicine; nursing; women; 1940s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Caption under top photo reads, "The ceremony and business session were sponsored by the Volunteer Special Services Section of the American Red Cross, Memphis Chapter. Mrs. Gaut is section chairman. Speakers emphasized the necessity for continuing the work of the Nurses Aides in Memphis Hospitals. The volunteers received the citations for 'fine work during the war.'" -- Caption under the bottom photo reads, "Miss Dorothy Ballard (7), and more than 100 other young women received Nurses Aide merit certificates from Red Cross officials last night. At the speakers' table in the Officers Club were Mrs. Walter Chandler (1), Mrs. Carroll Turner (2), Mayor Chandler (3), Frank R. Ahlgren (4), editor of The Commercial Appeal, Mrs. Dave Gaut (5), and Mrs. Lena Lyon Saino (6)."
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Memphis - Nurses and nursing - Red Cross nurses aides
